thread.title: Fish and Game to host benefit cornhole tourney
thread.title_full: Fish and Game to host benefit cornhole tourney

title: Fish and Game to host benefit cornhole tourney
text:
Fish and Game to host benefit cornhole tourney By DEAN SHALHOUPStaff Writer 
The Fish and Game Club on Pine Road in Hudson will host a tour­nament Saturday after­noon featuring the in­creasingly popular lawn game called cornhole, as a benefit fundraiser for the newly formed South­ern New Hampshire chapter of The Cure Starts Now Foundation, a national initiative aimed at fighting, and eradicat­ing, a childhood cancer called brainstem glioma. 
Registration for the tournament starts at noon on Saturday, Oct. 10, with the games begin­ning at 1:30 p.m. Enry fee is $50 per team and play­ers are asked to bring two non-perishable food items. ... The Fish and Game Club on Pine Road in Hudson will host a tour­nament Saturday after­noon featuring the in­creasingly popular lawn game called cornhole, as a benefit fundraiser for the newly formed South­ern New Hampshire chapter of The Cure Starts Now Foundation, a national initiative aimed at fighting, and eradicat­ing, a childhood cancer called brainstem glioma. 
Registration for the tournament starts at noon on Saturday, Oct. 10, with the games begin­ning at 1:30 p.m. Enry fee is $50 per team and play­ers are asked to bring two non-perishable food items. 
The event, which runs until about 6 p.m., will also feature a 50/50 raffle, cash prizes and on-site food vendors, and is a BYOB event. 
Frank LaFountain, the grandfather of the late McKenzie Robin Lowe, founded the Southern New Hampshire chapter in memory of the Hudson girl, who died a year ago this month after a lengthy battle with diffuse intrin­sic pontine glioma, or DIPG, a cancer that af­fects the brainstem and is most common in elemen­tary-school-age children. 
The Southern New Hampshire chapter is the second The Cure Starts Now Foundation chapter in the state; the other is based in Gilford. 
Nationally, the founda­tion, based in Cincinnati, was launched in 2007 in honor of a 5-year-old girl named Elena, who died after a 9-month battle with brainstem glioma. 
For more information on the foundation and the Southern New Hamp­shire chapter, go to http://www.southernnewhampshire.thecurestartsnow.org/ . Top Jobs
